replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Installed git-cola yesterday, so far so good. Only thing I don't like so far is there is no easy way to amend a commit (or I haven't found it)

replies.author: gm
replies.message: Did you try the menu button on the left of the commit message text box. There is a checkbox (Ctrl+M)?

author: Christian
message: If you like working in a console but would like something similar to git gui, give "tig" a try. By far my favorite way to review and stage changes.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I use tig a lot to browse history, but can you do partial commits with tig? I looked for it briefly but did not find how to.

replies.author: Christian
replies.message: Yes you can =) tig status, and then "1" to stage a single line, "u" to stage a hunk, "\" to split hunks and "!" to revert a line or hunk. Especially the partial staging works so well for me in tig.

author: Fre3k
message: I've been using git gui for a while now and one cool feature when working with a remote server via ssh is that you can use X Forwarding and use git gui remotely that way, provided you have an X server running locally.
